intro: Indigastrum argyroides, commonly known as the silverleaf indigastrum, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a silvery or grayish underside, giving it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
